1: You head over to Mr skibidi and ask him where you are. "What do you mean, where are we? This is London, at least whatever remains of it after it keeps getting thrown around everywhere. How do you not know where we are? Are you a time traveller?"
You try to talk to Mr skibidi, but he just walks away.
2: Did you really think you could do that?
You try to name every rat. You can barely name 3.
3: You succesfully name every other rat. That didn't even help. What was the point of that?
You dont know how to name rats. Why would you?
4: You stand still... and you don't talk to Mr skibidi.
You're not very good at this.

Somehow, you end up going to Mr skibidi and talking to him. You ask him what the weather is tomorrow. He looks at you confused. "Weather? We're in the stratosphere! We don't even have weather... normally. Why would you even ask me for weather? I sell words, I'm not a weatherman."
5: Going to roofmart, or so you thought
You ask someone where roofmart is. They tell you its across the street. It isn't.
You ask someone where roofmart is. They look at you like that doesn't make any sense. Probably because it didn't.
6: He is shooting rats with some sort of rifle, except he doesn't appear to be very good at aiming. He's constantly missing, and for some reason there are a ton of rats around here so it's sort of hard to miss them.
7: You agree, as of course, killing every rat is not that bad. Although it may take some time, you are now dedicated to bringing this place down to the surface.
8: You belive that killing rats is a stupid idea to solve this problem. He doesn't seem to agree, but you think hes irrational. First, you need to figure out how rats have names and what they are, because you have no idea what you are doing.
9: He doesn't really know. "Well, i think they do, but he was probably just spouting some nonsensical jargon or whatever. Don't go trying to name things that don't have names.
10: You need a weapon to kill rats of course, but the good ones are only found in Thetchry.
11: That was quite enjoyable, as killing rats is nice. This probably won't do much though, as there are so many rats it's impossible to kill them all with just a rifle. You'll have to find another way.
You miss and miss every single rat you come across. You barely kill any rats.
12:
You go ahead and buy the Rat Shooting Rifle. The only problem with it, is that it's incredibly tiny in size, and you can barely hold it from the handle.

You, of course, need a refund and ask the manager for a refund. "Uhh, we can take the weapon back but we won't recompense you. Sorry, no refunds. Besides, the RAT firing rifle is actually for rats and not people. Obviously. Why don't you know that? Have a great day!"
13: The person at the desk goes into a door, with mysterious black fog coming out of it. It's probably fine. He gets you your Human Firing Rifle, and it's the correct size.
18: You pick up some loose change that's on the floor, but there isn't much.
You can't scavenge anything at all! It's like nobody even has money to drop.
20: Everyone is buying rocks, and you now have some actual money.
21: You tell someone some long fake story about some artifact that apparently was here, and as you're leaving you graze past them and take all their money. The didn't have much.
You're not the best at pickpocketing. Turns out they don't even have money anyway.
22: You guess and guess and eventually you get an actual gain with your money.
You're not as good as you thought you were.
23: You push them off the edge, and they start to fall down. They get teleported back a few times, and do a lot of other weird things. Eventually, they disappear.
24: You extend your hand slowly past the border, and quickly pull it back. Nothing happens.
You extend your hand slowly past the border, but you feel a burning sensation and quickly pull it back. Your hand is on fire.
25: You walk past the border, and stand still. Suddenly, you are pushed off the edge! You fall for a very long time. Too long. You see the ground, and close your eyes, but you don't land. You open your eyes and you back in London. Did you even fall?

You walk past the border, and stand still. Suddenly, you are pushed off the edge! For some reason, you are still standing. But you are not on ground, you are in the air, and you can't see very well. You feel like you are falling, and you don't have much time left...
26: You are sent back to London.
You plummet to the ground and die.
27: You are somehow sent back to Thetchry.
You step forward, and there is no ground below you. You fall, and the fog quickly gets thicker. Eventually, you land. You are not hurt, but you feel ill.
28: You are somehow sent back to Thetchry.
You are definitely falling now. The fog is getting thicker, and you can't breathe well. You land. Somehow, you are unscathed.
31: You walk slightly forward, and you recognize this person. There are about 5 people behind him. This is the person you threw off the side of the border. He looks at you, and kicks you into a inconvenient and oddly placed hole. You fall for quite some time.

You walk slightly forward, and you recognize this person. There are about 5 people behind him. This is the person you threw off the side of the border. He looks at you, and kicks you into a inconvenient and oddly placed hole. You fall for quite some time.

Don't talk to Mr skibidi: You can just do anything else.
Get a gun: You need a weapon to kill rats.
Watch the man shooting rats: What did the rats do to him? Find out today! Or tomorrow! Or never!

The man:
You ask him why he is trying to kill the rats so aggresively, and he tells you a lot. "Of course you don't understand.
Say, maybe around 100 - 120 years ago some person put a curse on this place. Not many people actually care though, living up here isn't all that bad. But anyway, this person basically put this whole place in the sky, and if somebody doesn't name every single rat, then it won't go back down. And don't try to just leave, you'll get disintigrated. Probably. Weird things happen past the border, but the point is every single rat has to be named. And since we aren't stupid, we're not going to do that. If you kill every rat in the entire place, you won't have to name any! Still easier said than done."
Just name all the rats: Naming them is probably easier. Theres probably some loopholes for that too.

Getting a weapon: Might be important for killing rats, or maybe people.
Shoot some rats: That's what you were trying to do.
Get some more money: Maybe you need a better weapon because of unfortunate circumstances, perhaps you just like money, or maybe you just like the experience.
Walk past the border: For some reason, the border isn't far away, and doesn't even cover the entire area. What could go wrong?
Walk past the border, yet again: For some reason, the border isn't far away, and doesn't even cover the entire area. What could go wrong? Only your life.

Purchasing a weapon:
Thetchry, the place that sells every weapon you could thing of* and everything you didn't think of*.*Restrictions Apply
Over at the store, you see an assortment of fireworks, flamethrowers, and an entire isle dedicated to "Emergency Blunderbusses" or something like that.
Buy a Rat Firing Rifle: Built by rats, for- err, uhh, just buy it. No, you can't take a look at it!
Buy a Human Firing Rifle: Built by humans, for humans to use.
Buy an Emergency Blunderbuss: The high price is only because of supply and demand. Yes, we have a lot, it's just everyone wants one.
Buy a Plasma Rifle: This will easily obliterate anything in your way, but it cost so much to make we only have one.

Going somewhere: Where do you want to go?

Obtaining money: You're going to need it to purchase items.
Ask people for money: Nobody in Risen London really has any money, so this probably won't work.
Set up a store for some rocks you found: Some people will probably buy them.

You're right next to the border.
Walk past the border: Do you have a brain? This is a horrible idea.
To the surface!: Don't jump off! What are you doing?

It's time to leave: It's finally time to exit this place.

It's finally time to exit this floor.

Falling?: You are in the air, but completely still. You don't see yourself falling, but you can't really see anything since a mysterious black fog has enveloped you. You feel like you are falling.
